trans-unit.source: Tutorial
trans-unit.target: Tutorial

trans-unit.id: The UH team
trans-unit.source: The UH team
trans-unit.target: Het UH team

trans-unit.id: The tutorial: Build your first settlement and learn how to play!
trans-unit.source: The tutorial: Build your first settlement and learn how to play!
trans-unit.target: De tutorial: Plaats uw eerste kolonie en leer het spelverloop!

trans-unit.id: Build a branch office at the coast.
trans-unit.source: Build a branch office at the coast.
trans-unit.target: Plaats een kantoor aan de kust.

trans-unit.id: Welcome to Unknown Horizons!
trans-unit.source: Welcome to Unknown Horizons!
trans-unit.target: Welcom by Unknown Horizons!

trans-unit.id:
This is your Captain's log where all important information is stored. A short notification of each task will be provided on the left of the screen.
If you are interested in longer descriptions, your log will hopefully provide all the help you need.
After you close this log, it can be re-opened with the 'Captain's Log' icon in the top-right corner (below the mini-map, with a sealed document and a feather).
For any suggestions on better wording, topics you would like to have explained or even buggy conditions: Please tell us and we will try to improve the tutorial!
Visit www.unknown-horizons.org for help on how to contact the team!
And now, let's start the actual game.
trans-unit.source:
This is your Captain's log where all important information is stored. A short notification of each task will be provided on the left of the screen.
If you are interested in longer descriptions, your log will hopefully provide all the help you need.
After you close this log, it can be re-opened with the 'Captain's Log' icon in the top-right corner (below the mini-map, with a sealed document and a feather).
For any suggestions on better wording, topics you would like to have explained or even buggy conditions: Please tell us and we will try to improve the tutorial!
Visit www.unknown-horizons.org for help on how to contact the team!
And now, let's start the actual game.
trans-unit.target:
This is your Captain's log where all important information is stored. A short notification of each task will be provided on the left of the screen.
If you are interested in longer descriptions, your log will hopefully provide all the help you need.
After you close this log, it can be re-opened with the 'Captain's Log' icon in the top-right corner (below the mini-map, with a sealed document and a feather).
For any suggestions on better wording, topics you would like to have explained or even buggy conditions: Please tell us and we will try to improve the tutorial!
Visit www.unknown-horizons.org for help on how to contact the team!
And now, let's start the actual game.

trans-unit.id: NEW TASK: SETTLE ON AN ISLAND
trans-unit.source: NEW TASK: SETTLE ON AN ISLAND
trans-unit.target: OPDRACHT: KOLONISEER EEN EILAND

trans-unit.id:
To move your ship, select it with a left click and right click on the location you want it to go to.
Once you are near the coast, the anchor-like button you see in the overview tab will become active.
This indicates that you are able to build a branch office there by pressing that button (called 'Build Settlement').
Now a preview of your building is dragged around when you move the cursor.
You can build on any spot where this preview is not shaded red. Click where you want to place your first building.
TASK: Build a branch office at the coast.
trans-unit.source:
To move your ship, select it with a left click and right click on the location you want it to go to.
Once you are near the coast, the anchor-like button you see in the overview tab will become active.
This indicates that you are able to build a branch office there by pressing that button (called 'Build Settlement').
Now a preview of your building is dragged around when you move the cursor.
You can build on any spot where this preview is not shaded red. Click where you want to place your first building.
TASK: Build a branch office at the coast.
trans-unit.target:
Om Uw schip te bewegen, selecteer het met een linker muisklik en klik rechts op de locatie waar het schip naar toe moet varen.
Zodra het schip bij de kust is, wordt de knop met het anker in het overzicht scherm actief.
Dit betekend dat U een kantoor kunt plaatsen door op deze knop te klikken (genaamd 'Plaats Kolonie').
Een voorbeeld van het gebouw wordt getoond wanneer U de cursor beweegt.
U kunt het gebouw plaatsen op iedere locatie waar het voorbeeld niet rood is. Klik waar U Uw eerste gebouw wilt plaatsen.
OPDRACHT: Plaats een kantoor aan de kust.

trans-unit.id: NEW TASK: UNLOAD YOUR GOODS
trans-unit.source: NEW TASK: UNLOAD YOUR GOODS
trans-unit.target: OPDRACHT: LAAD DE GOEDEREN UIT

trans-unit.id:
Now that you have built the Branch Office, you need to move some of your resources to its stock.
To do so, select your ship and go into the tab with the wooden box icon called 'Ship Inventory'.
Here you get an overview of what this ship's cargo looks like and have the button 'Load/Unload'.
This button becomes active if your ship is in range of a possible trade partner like a branch office.
Click on the button. If it is not active, move your ship towards the branch office and then try again.
TASK: Open the trade dialogue.
trans-unit.source:
Now that you have built the Branch Office, you need to move some of your resources to its stock.
To do so, select your ship and go into the tab with the wooden box icon called 'Ship Inventory'.
Here you get an overview of what this ship's cargo looks like and have the button 'Load/Unload'.
This button becomes active if your ship is in range of a possible trade partner like a branch office.
Click on the button. If it is not active, move your ship towards the branch office and then try again.
TASK: Open the trade dialogue.
trans-unit.target:
Nu het kantoor geplaatst is, moeten grondstoffen worden verplaatst naar zijn voorraad.
Selecteer het schip en open het scherm 'Scheepsvoorraad' door op de knop met de houten krat te klikken.
Hier is een overzicht van de voorraad van het schip en een knop 'Laden/uitladen'.
Deze knop wordt actief zodra Uw schip in de buurt is van een mogelijke handelspartner, zoals het kantoor
Klik op de knop. Verplaats U schip dichterbij het kantoor als de knop niet actief is en probeer opnieuw.
OPDRACHT: Open het handels scherm.

trans-unit.id:
The tab you will see is split into 'Ship' and 'Settlement' as trade partners.
To move goods from one stock to the other, simply click on them.
Try clicking on the boards currently on your ship first and then try moving them back.
You can customize the quantity moved by using the self-explanatory radio buttons in the middle.
Did you get used to the trade tab? You need some construction material in your settlement now!
TASK: Unload at least 10 tons of each resource your ship sailed around with.
trans-unit.source:
The tab you will see is split into 'Ship' and 'Settlement' as trade partners.
To move goods from one stock to the other, simply click on them.
Try clicking on the boards currently on your ship first and then try moving them back.
You can customize the quantity moved by using the self-explanatory radio buttons in the middle.
Did you get used to the trade tab? You need some construction material in your settlement now!
TASK: Unload at least 10 tons of each resource your ship sailed around with.
trans-unit.target:
Het scherm wat U ziet is verdeeld in 'Schip' en 'Kolonie' als handelspartners.
Om goederen van een voorraad naar de andere voorraad te verplaatsen, kunt U simpelweg er op klikken
Probeer eerst op de planken op het schip te klikken en probeer vervolgens deze terug te plaatsen.
U kunt de verplaatste hoeveelheid aanpassen met de radio buttons in het midden
Heeft U zichzelf bekend gemaakt met het handelsscherm? U heeft nu constructie materiaal nodig in uw kolonie!
OPDRACHT: Laad tenminste 10 ton van iedere groundstof op het schip uit.

trans-unit.id: Unload at least 10 tons of each resource on your ship.
trans-unit.source: Unload at least 10 tons of each resource on your ship.
trans-unit.target: Laad tenminste 10 ton van iedere grondstof op het schip.

trans-unit.id: NEW TASK: BUILD A LUMBERJACK
trans-unit.source: NEW TASK: BUILD A LUMBERJACK
trans-unit.target: OPDRACHT: EEN HOUTHAKKER

trans-unit.id:
With your new construction material in the branch office, you can start to construct some basic buildings.
We will start with building a lumberjack.
This is essential because, at this stage, boards are the only poles your sailors can afford to hang their tents over.
The fisherman needs some boards to build his vessel as well.
In order to construct lumberjacks; open the build menu by either clicking the big icon below the mini map or pressing B key.
The build menu is sorted by increments. You are currently in the first increment (the Sailors level) so are offered only the basic buildings.
trans-unit.source:
With your new construction material in the branch office, you can start to construct some basic buildings.
We will start with building a lumberjack.
This is essential because, at this stage, boards are the only poles your sailors can afford to hang their tents over.
The fisherman needs some boards to build his vessel as well.
In order to construct lumberjacks; open the build menu by either clicking the big icon below the mini map or pressing B key.
The build menu is sorted by increments. You are currently in the first increment (the Sailors level) so are offered only the basic buildings.
trans-unit.target:
Met het nieuwe constructie materiaal in het kantoor kunnen de eerste gebouwen geplaatst worden.
We zullen starten met het plaatsen van een houthakker.
De houthakker is belangrijk aangezien planken in deze fase de enige middelen zijn die de zeelui kunnen gebruiken voor hun tenten.
De visser heeft ook hout nodig om zijn schip te maken.
Om een houthakker te plaatsen, op het constructie menu door op de grote knop onder de kleine kaart te klikken of druk de B toets.
Het constructie menu is gesorteerd op niveau's. Dat betekent dat alleen standaard gebouwen beschikbaar zijn op het zeelui niveau (waarop U zich nu bevindt).

trans-unit.id:
As your civilization advances, you also gain more and more complex buildings.
For now, select the lumberjack under 'Companies' and build it in an area with some trees around.
You can also plant trees later - but that costs money. Use what nature provided you with!
A company always needs a trail connection to a storage or branch office, otherwise goods will remain at the company and not be collected.
This means that you have to build a trail connecting your branch office (or storage) and lumberjack.
TASK: Build a lumberjack in a wooded area and connect it to a road.
Watch how a collector will fetch your first self-produced boards.
trans-unit.source:
As your civilization advances, you also gain more and more complex buildings.
For now, select the lumberjack under 'Companies' and build it in an area with some trees around.
You can also plant trees later - but that costs money. Use what nature provided you with!
A company always needs a trail connection to a storage or branch office, otherwise goods will remain at the company and not be collected.
This means that you have to build a trail connecting your branch office (or storage) and lumberjack.
TASK: Build a lumberjack in a wooded area and connect it to a road.
Watch how a collector will fetch your first self-produced boards.
trans-unit.target:
Met het uitbreiden van Uw kolonie kunnen ook complexe gebouwen geplaatst worden.
Selecteer de houthakker onder 'Bedrijven' en plaats het in een regio met veel bomen.
U kunt ook bomen planten - maar dat kost geld. Gebruik wat wordt aangeboden door de natuur!
Een bedrijf heeft altijd een wegverbinding nodig tussen een opslagruimte of kantoor, anders worden goederen niet opgehaald.
Dat betekent dat U een weg moet plaatsen die het kantoor en de houthakker verbindt.
OPDRACHT: Plaats een houthakker in bebost gebied en verbind het met een weg.
Let op hoe een verzamelaar Uw eerste zelf geproduceerde planken ophaalt.

trans-unit.id: Build a lumberjack and connect it to the branch office using a trail.
trans-unit.source: Build a lumberjack and connect it to the branch office using a trail.
trans-unit.target: Plaats een houthakker en verbind deze met het kantoor met een weg.

trans-unit.id: NEW TASK: FOOD SUPPLY
trans-unit.source: NEW TASK: FOOD SUPPLY
trans-unit.target: OPDRACHT: VOEDSEL AANBOD

trans-unit.id:
You will need to have some food-producing companies, too, because people in general (and especially sailors) are very hungry.
Available companies in the first increment are the Hunter and Fisher.
The Hunter, surprisingly, hunts animals in the forest, so he needs trees around.
Note that you can place your Hunter close to the lumberjack's forest.
It can happen that the animals don't reproduce fast enough or simply hide well.
Conclusion: the hunter is not too reliable if you need continuous supply.
trans-unit.source:
You will need to have some food-producing companies, too, because people in general (and especially sailors) are very hungry.
Available companies in the first increment are the Hunter and Fisher.
The Hunter, surprisingly, hunts animals in the forest, so he needs trees around.
Note that you can place your Hunter close to the lumberjack's forest.
It can happen that the animals don't reproduce fast enough or simply hide well.
Conclusion: the hunter is not too reliable if you need continuous supply.
trans-unit.target:
Er zijn voedsel producerende bedrijven nodig. Kolonisten, en in het bijzonder zeelui, zijn erg hongerig.
Beschikbare bedrijven in het eerste niveau zijn de Jager en de Visser.
De Jager jaagt op dieren in het bos, hiervoor moeten er bomen nabij zijn.
Merk op dat U het dichtbij het bos van de houthakker kunt plaatsen.
Het kan gebeuren dat dieren niet snel genoeg voortplanten of zich goed verstoppen.
Conclusie: de jager is niet betrouwbaar genoeg voor een gelijkmatig aanbod van voedsel.

trans-unit.id:
The Fisher needs a coastal building site like the branch office - and nothing more.
He will build a small rowing vessel and catch some fish.
This is a very constant supply at the cost of a slightly longer production time per unit of food.
A small settlement like yours can use both companies, and you can better balance pros and cons if you see the direct comparison.
TASK: Build a hunter and a fisher.
Don't forget to connect them to your branch office with trails!
trans-unit.source:
The Fisher needs a coastal building site like the branch office - and nothing more.
He will build a small rowing vessel and catch some fish.
This is a very constant supply at the cost of a slightly longer production time per unit of food.
A small settlement like yours can use both companies, and you can better balance pros and cons if you see the direct comparison.
TASK: Build a hunter and a fisher.
Don't forget to connect them to your branch office with trails!
trans-unit.target:
De visser heeft een gebouw nodig op een plaats aan de kust, zoals het kantoor, en niets meer.
Hij zal een kleine roeiboot maken en vis vangen.
Dit is een zeer constante aanvoer van voedsel. Nadeel is dat het relatief lang duurt om een eenheid voedsel te produceren.
Een kleine nederzetting zoals Uw nederzetting kan beide bedrijven goed gebruiken. U kunt de voor- en nadelen afwegen welke het meeste geschikt is.
OPDRACHT: Plaats een jager en een visser.
Vergeet geen wegen aan te leggen naar het kantoor!

trans-unit.id: Build a hunter and a fisher. Connect them to the branch office.
trans-unit.source: Build a hunter and a fisher. Connect them to the branch office.
trans-unit.target: Plaats een jager en een visser. Verbind ze met het kantoor.

trans-unit.id: NEW TASK: MAIN SQUARE
trans-unit.source: NEW TASK: MAIN SQUARE
trans-unit.target: OPDRACHT: PLEIN

trans-unit.id:
Your residents need a main square where they can fetch their goods from.
This means that they need a trail connection from their home to the main square.
All goods in your branch office are available at this 'market place', so your residents do not need to walk to the fisher or even to the branch office.
You should consider founding your actual house settlement in an area where you can easily expand it and build some trails, too.
You should avoid placing tents too close to your lumberjacks for example because building tents will clear away the trees that your lumberjack needs to produce boards.
TASK: Build a main square.
trans-unit.source:
Your residents need a main square where they can fetch their goods from.
This means that they need a trail connection from their home to the main square.
All goods in your branch office are available at this 'market place', so your residents do not need to walk to the fisher or even to the branch office.
You should consider founding your actual house settlement in an area where you can easily expand it and build some trails, too.
You should avoid placing tents too close to your lumberjacks for example because building tents will clear away the trees that your lumberjack needs to produce boards.
TASK: Build a main square.
trans-unit.target:
Uw inwoners hebben een plein nodig waar ze goederen kunnen ophalen.
Dit betekent dat het plein en hun huis met een weg verbonden moeten zijn.
Alle goederen in het kantoor zijn beschikbaar op deze 'marktplaats', zeelui hoeven dus niet naar de visser of het kantoor te lopen.
Overweeg goed waar U de huizen in de nederzetting plaatst: Een gebied dat eenvoudig kan worden uitgebreid en eenvoudig wegen geplaatst kunnen worden.
Plaats geen tenten dichtbij de houthakker. De houthakker heeft ruimte nodig voor bomen.
OPDRACHT: Plaats een plein.

trans-unit.id:
Now let's have a closer look at the main square.
In the overview tab you can quickly adjust taxes.
In the second tab 'Account' you get a balance sheet of this island, featuring all costs you pay and all taxes you earn.
The items 'Sale' and 'Buy' refer to your trading balance and will be explained later on.
If your balance is positive, you all-in-all make a profit.
In the 'Settler' tab you can see how happy your inhabitants are and what resource most of them want to be supplied with.
trans-unit.source:
Now let's have a closer look at the main square.
In the overview tab you can quickly adjust taxes.
In the second tab 'Account' you get a balance sheet of this island, featuring all costs you pay and all taxes you earn.
The items 'Sale' and 'Buy' refer to your trading balance and will be explained later on.
If your balance is positive, you all-in-all make a profit.
In the 'Settler' tab you can see how happy your inhabitants are and what resource most of them want to be supplied with.
trans-unit.target:
Laten we het plein nader bekijken.
In het overzicht scherm kunt U belastingen eenvoudig aanpassen.
Het tweede scherm 'Rekening' toont een balans, hierop staan alle kosten die U betaald heeft en alle belastingen die U ontvangen heeft.
De opties 'Verkoop' en 'Inkoop' verwijzen naar de handels balans en zal later uitgelegd worden.
Als de balans positief is betekent dit dat U winst maakt.
In het scherm 'Kolonisten' kunt U zien hoe blij de inwoners zijn en welke goederen ze het meest nodig hebben.

trans-unit.id: Build a main square. Choose an area without many economy buildings.
trans-unit.source: Build a main square. Choose an area without many economy buildings.
trans-unit.target: Plaats een plein. Kies een gebied zonder economische gebouwen.

trans-unit.id: NEW TASK: RESIDENTIAL BUILDINGS
trans-unit.source: NEW TASK: RESIDENTIAL BUILDINGS
trans-unit.target: OPDRACHT: RESIDENTIELE GEBOUWEN

trans-unit.id:
Settlers want to have a roof over their heads, else they won't even think of living in your city! You need to provide tents.
Tents are the basic residential buildings. Your inhabitants will want to upgrade it when they reach higher increments.
Settlers may not look very useful since they will try to consume all goods you produce - but they at least pay taxes, and that's the only way you can make money for now!
TASK: Build a tent and connect it to the main square.
trans-unit.source:
Settlers want to have a roof over their heads, else they won't even think of living in your city! You need to provide tents.
Tents are the basic residential buildings. Your inhabitants will want to upgrade it when they reach higher increments.
Settlers may not look very useful since they will try to consume all goods you produce - but they at least pay taxes, and that's the only way you can make money for now!
TASK: Build a tent and connect it to the main square.
trans-unit.target:
Kolonisten willen graag een dak boven hun hoofd, anders zullen ze zich niet vestigen. U dient tenten te plaatsen!
Tenten zijn de eenvoudigste gebouwen voor inwoners.
Uw inwoners zullen deze verbeteren zodra ze hogere niveau's bereiken.
Zeelui lijken niet nuttig aangezien ze proberen alles te gebruiken wat je produceert - maar ze betalen wel belastingen.
Dat is voorlopig de enige manier om geld te verdienen.
OPDRACHT: Plaats een tent en verbind deze met het plein.

trans-unit.id: Build a tent and connect it to the main square.
trans-unit.source: Build a tent and connect it to the main square.
trans-unit.target: Plaats een tent en verbind deze met het plein.

trans-unit.id:
Let's have a look at the tent overview tab. You can see * the happiness of these residents, * the taxes they pay and * the resources they demand.
If their demands are fulfilled, happiness and thus your tax income increase.
If not, happiness and income decrease. At some time your residents may get really sour and simply turn their back on your village, leaving behind a decaying ruin.
Note that you can also change the global tax settings here, too.
TASK: Build at least three additional tents.
TIP: Holding down SHIFT eases constructing multiple buildings of the same kind.
trans-unit.source:
Let's have a look at the tent overview tab. You can see * the happiness of these residents, * the taxes they pay and * the resources they demand.
If their demands are fulfilled, happiness and thus your tax income increase.
If not, happiness and income decrease. At some time your residents may get really sour and simply turn their back on your village, leaving behind a decaying ruin.
Note that you can also change the global tax settings here, too.
TASK: Build at least three additional tents.
TIP: Holding down SHIFT eases constructing multiple buildings of the same kind.
trans-unit.target:
Laten we naar het tent overzicht scherm kijken. U kunt zien * de gelukkigheid van de bewoners * de belastingen die ze betalen en * de grondstoffen die ze vereisen.
Wanneer hun wensen worden voldaan, zullen hun gelukkigheid en Uw belastinginkomsten toenemen.
Zo niet, zullen gelukkigheid en inkomsten afnemen. Wanneer de bewoners niet gelukkig meer zijn zullen ze de nederzetting verlaten en een ruïne achterlaten.
Merk op dat u hier ook de belasting instellingen kunt wijzigen.
OPDRACHT: Plaats tenminste drie extra tenten.
TIP: Om meerdere gebouwen van het zelfde soort te plaatsen kunt u SHIFT indrukken.

trans-unit.id: Build at least three additional tents and connect them to the main square.
trans-unit.source: Build at least three additional tents and connect them to the main square.
trans-unit.target: Plaats tenminste drie extra tenten en verbind deze met het plein.

trans-unit.id: NEW TASK: BUILD SIGNAL FIRE
trans-unit.source: NEW TASK: BUILD SIGNAL FIRE
trans-unit.target: OPDRACHT: SIGNAAL VUUR

trans-unit.id:
Can you see the ship passing your island from time to time?
This is the ship of the Free Trader, one of the first settlers in this archipelago.
This trader will supply your settlement with necessary goods which you can't produce yet.
You can also sell surpluses of your production, but in general consuming them (by building more tents) instead of selling to the Free Trader yields more profit.
Normally the ships just sail around and look for deals, but small settlements like yours first need some promotion, otherwise you won't be found.
For this purpose, you can build a signal fire at the coast near your branch office to show ships the way to your settlement.
trans-unit.source:
Can you see the ship passing your island from time to time?
This is the ship of the Free Trader, one of the first settlers in this archipelago.
This trader will supply your settlement with necessary goods which you can't produce yet.
You can also sell surpluses of your production, but in general consuming them (by building more tents) instead of selling to the Free Trader yields more profit.
Normally the ships just sail around and look for deals, but small settlements like yours first need some promotion, otherwise you won't be found.
For this purpose, you can build a signal fire at the coast near your branch office to show ships the way to your settlement.
trans-unit.target:
Can you see the ship passing your island from time to time?
This is the ship of the Free Trader, one of the first settlers in this archipelago.
This trader will supply your settlement with necessary goods which you can't produce yet.
You can also sell surpluses of your production, but in general consuming them (by building more tents) instead of selling to the Free Trader yields more profit.
Normally the ships just sail around and look for deals, but small settlements like yours first need some promotion, otherwise you won't be found.
For this purpose, you can build a signal fire at the coast near your branch office to show ships the way to your settlement.

trans-unit.id:
After this little advertisment, the trader will stop by from time to time and look into your branch office.
You can propose deals via the tab 'Buy/Sell'. (This feature is currently quite fiddly to use, but a re-design is in the pipeline. If you have found a nice way of doing it, please share your thoughts! We need your help here!)
At the 'sailors' increment, you are equipped with three trading slots.
Click on the small icon to change the slot mode from 'Buy' to 'Sell' and vice versa.
If you click in the slot, you can choose the good you want to trade with. We will further explain this once you are ready to trade.
TASK: Build a signal fire at the coast close to your branch office.
trans-unit.source:
After this little advertisment, the trader will stop by from time to time and look into your branch office.
You can propose deals via the tab 'Buy/Sell'. (This feature is currently quite fiddly to use, but a re-design is in the pipeline. If you have found a nice way of doing it, please share your thoughts! We need your help here!)
At the 'sailors' increment, you are equipped with three trading slots.
Click on the small icon to change the slot mode from 'Buy' to 'Sell' and vice versa.
If you click in the slot, you can choose the good you want to trade with. We will further explain this once you are ready to trade.
TASK: Build a signal fire at the coast close to your branch office.
trans-unit.target:
After this little advertisment, the trader will stop by from time to time and look into your branch office.
You can propose deals via the tab 'Buy/Sell'. (This feature is currently quite fiddly to use, but a re-design is in the pipeline. If you have found a nice way of doing it, please share your thoughts! We need your help here!)
At the 'sailors' increment, you are equipped with three trading slots.
Click on the small icon to change the slot mode from 'Buy' to 'Sell' and vice versa.
If you click in the slot, you can choose the good you want to trade with. We will further explain this once you are ready to trade.
TASK: Build a signal fire at the coast close to your branch office.

trans-unit.id: Build a signal fire at the coast close to your branch office.
trans-unit.source: Build a signal fire at the coast close to your branch office.
trans-unit.target: Plaats een signaal vuur bij de kost nabij het kantoor.

trans-unit.id: NEW TASK: LEARN TO TRADE
trans-unit.source: NEW TASK: LEARN TO TRADE
trans-unit.target: OPDRACHT: LEER TE HANDELEN

trans-unit.id:
Excellent! The Free Trader will now stop by at your branch office from time to time.
Let's continue our tutorial on how to trade.
After selecting a particular type of good, the green bar across the bottom of the slot (if visible) shows you how much you have in stock of this good.
Dragging the slider on the right of each slot determines your 'target value' which has a different meaning on 'Buy' and 'Sell'. When buying, you will buy sufficient to hold your 'target value' in stock. When selling the 'target value' is the number which you hold in reserve to not sell
trans-unit.source:
Excellent! The Free Trader will now stop by at your branch office from time to time.
Let's continue our tutorial on how to trade.
After selecting a particular type of good, the green bar across the bottom of the slot (if visible) shows you how much you have in stock of this good.
Dragging the slider on the right of each slot determines your 'target value' which has a different meaning on 'Buy' and 'Sell'. When buying, you will buy sufficient to hold your 'target value' in stock. When selling the 'target value' is the number which you hold in reserve to not sell

trans-unit.id:
For example: Having a 'Buy' slot and 5 tons in stock, a slider positioned at 9 tons will cause you to buy 4 additional tons at most. Selling works similarly. A 'Sell' slot with 18 tons in stock and the slider positioned at 13 will sell up to 5 tons.
If the free trader however only wants to buy or sell less than your settings would allow him, you need to live with that and wait for him to return.
Unknown Horizons features smart pricing, so the value of one unit can vary. It is NOT possible to change prices manually!
You can see your trade balance in the 'Account' tab comparing the 'Sale' and 'Buy' values there.
TASK: Buy as many tools as you need to have 30 tools in stock! If you still have some in your ship's inventory, this seems like a good point to unload them.
trans-unit.source:
For example: Having a 'Buy' slot and 5 tons in stock, a slider positioned at 9 tons will cause you to buy 4 additional tons at most. Selling works similarly. A 'Sell' slot with 18 tons in stock and the slider positioned at 13 will sell up to 5 tons.
If the free trader however only wants to buy or sell less than your settings would allow him, you need to live with that and wait for him to return.
Unknown Horizons features smart pricing, so the value of one unit can vary. It is NOT possible to change prices manually!
You can see your trade balance in the 'Account' tab comparing the 'Sale' and 'Buy' values there.
TASK: Buy as many tools as you need to have 30 tools in stock! If you still have some in your ship's inventory, this seems like a good point to unload them.

trans-unit.id: Reach an island stock of at least 30 tools.
trans-unit.source: Reach an island stock of at least 30 tools.
trans-unit.target: Bereik een voorraad van tenminste 30 stuks gereedschap.

trans-unit.id: NEW TASK: BUILD A PAVILION
trans-unit.source: NEW TASK: BUILD A PAVILION
trans-unit.target: OPDRACHT: PLAATS EEN PAVILIOEN

trans-unit.id:
Those tools will be enough for the moment. Well done!
You now provide housing, a main square and food to your inhabitants.
Still there is one demand which we have not satisfied so far, you may check that in the maketplace or tent tab - your sailors want a basic building where they can pray.
The solution is a pavilion which the village parson quickly puts up as shelter from the sun.
Service buildings like this also need to be connected to the tents with a trail, else your inhabitants feel unable to reach them.
In later increments, upgraded versions of buildings may become available.
trans-unit.source:
Those tools will be enough for the moment. Well done!
You now provide housing, a main square and food to your inhabitants.
Still there is one demand which we have not satisfied so far, you may check that in the maketplace or tent tab - your sailors want a basic building where they can pray.
The solution is a pavilion which the village parson quickly puts up as shelter from the sun.
Service buildings like this also need to be connected to the tents with a trail, else your inhabitants feel unable to reach them.
In later increments, upgraded versions of buildings may become available.

trans-unit.id:
In that case the 'small' version is not needed anymore since the 'big' one will also provide what your inhabitants are looking for in early increments.
Take care when planning your city because most of those advanced buildings are bigger than the basic ones.
Note that faith is treated like a physical resource, so units need to refresh there after some time.
Important: It is NOT enough that the building is merely within a certain range of the tents.
TASK: Build a pavilion with a trail to the tents in order to fulfill your sailors' demand for faith.
trans-unit.source:
In that case the 'small' version is not needed anymore since the 'big' one will also provide what your inhabitants are looking for in early increments.
Take care when planning your city because most of those advanced buildings are bigger than the basic ones.
Note that faith is treated like a physical resource, so units need to refresh there after some time.
Important: It is NOT enough that the building is merely within a certain range of the tents.
TASK: Build a pavilion with a trail to the tents in order to fulfill your sailors' demand for faith.
trans-unit.target:
In dat geval is de 'kleine' versie is niet meer nodig omdat de 'grote' ook biedt wat Uw inwoners met een laag niveau zoeken.
Houd bij het ontwikkelen van Uw stad er rekening mee dat geavanceerde gebouwen groter zijn dan de basis gebouwen.
Let erop dat geloof wordt behandeld als een physieke grondstof, eenheden moeten zich na bepaalde tijd verfrissen.
Het is in het bijzonder NIET voldoende dat het gebouw binnen een bepaalde afstand staat.
OPDRACHT: Plaats een pavilioen met een verbinden naar de tenten om te voldoen aan de vraag naar geloof van de zeelui.

trans-unit.id: Build a pavilion with connection to the tents.
trans-unit.source: Build a pavilion with connection to the tents.
trans-unit.target: Plaats een pavilioen met verbinding naar de tenten.

trans-unit.id: NEW TASK: NEXT INCREMENT
trans-unit.source: NEW TASK: NEXT INCREMENT
trans-unit.target: OPDRACHT: VOLGENDE NIVEAU

trans-unit.id:
All demands are fulfilled now if your inhabitants can regularly visit the main square & pavilion and your food supply is adequate.
If the sailors are happy enough, they want to advance to the next increment called Pioneers.
To make them happy, there is nothing else for you to do but setting taxes to a lower level since you have fulfilled all the demands of your inhabitants.
You should try to not always run on low taxes since this will probably lead to bankruptcy sooner or later. For a period of time and if you know what you are doing, it is fine though.
After some time, the first unit should walk to the main square and have a look for new construction material there to build a log house. This house will replace the old tent.
trans-unit.source:
All demands are fulfilled now if your inhabitants can regularly visit the main square & pavilion and your food supply is adequate.
If the sailors are happy enough, they want to advance to the next increment called Pioneers.
To make them happy, there is nothing else for you to do but setting taxes to a lower level since you have fulfilled all the demands of your inhabitants.
You should try to not always run on low taxes since this will probably lead to bankruptcy sooner or later. For a period of time and if you know what you are doing, it is fine though.
After some time, the first unit should walk to the main square and have a look for new construction material there to build a log house. This house will replace the old tent.

trans-unit.id:
Such residential upgrades are the only ones which cost resources and can not be restricted by you.
There are manual upgrades to some buildings where you use resources to construct a better version on the same spot, and there are upgrades without costs for example as you will see with the lumberjack (In this case, only the graphics change).
Upgraded housing accomodates more inhabitants, and pioneers pay more taxes than sailors, too.
As you may have figured out already, the downside is that pioneers demand additional goods which sailors do not need - so you will need to spend this extra money to make them happy as well.
TASK: Set the tax level to Low (left end) and wait for sailors to upgrade.
trans-unit.source:
Such residential upgrades are the only ones which cost resources and can not be restricted by you.
There are manual upgrades to some buildings where you use resources to construct a better version on the same spot, and there are upgrades without costs for example as you will see with the lumberjack (In this case, only the graphics change).
Upgraded housing accomodates more inhabitants, and pioneers pay more taxes than sailors, too.
As you may have figured out already, the downside is that pioneers demand additional goods which sailors do not need - so you will need to spend this extra money to make them happy as well.
TASK: Set the tax level to Low (left end) and wait for sailors to upgrade.

trans-unit.id: Set the tax level to Low (left end) and wait for your sailors to upgrade.
trans-unit.source: Set the tax level to Low (left end) and wait for your sailors to upgrade.
trans-unit.target: Zet het belasting niveau op laag (linkerkant) en wacht totdat de zeelui promoveren.

trans-unit.id: NEW TASK: BUILD A FARM
trans-unit.source: NEW TASK: BUILD A FARM
trans-unit.target: OPDRACHT: EEN BOERDERIJ

trans-unit.id:
Congratulations! Some of your inhabitants have reached increment II!
Now you have access to some new buildings, have a look at the Build menu again.
A shiny new tab appeared there.
Pioneers will demand cloth, so you need to set up a production line for cloth starting with lambs wool (which is one of the goods produced at the farm).
The farm is a very special production building since it can produce not only one, but very many (and different) goods if you choose.
The output of farms depends on what kind of fields you build around it.
trans-unit.source:
Congratulations! Some of your inhabitants have reached increment II!
Now you have access to some new buildings, have a look at the Build menu again.
A shiny new tab appeared there.
Pioneers will demand cloth, so you need to set up a production line for cloth starting with lambs wool (which is one of the goods produced at the farm).
The farm is a very special production building since it can produce not only one, but very many (and different) goods if you choose.
The output of farms depends on what kind of fields you build around it.

trans-unit.id:
We will have a closer look at this later.
Farms, like all companies producing raw materials, do not necessarily need to be connected to storage or a Branch Office.
As long as units of the final production company can reach the farm, and collectors from the branch office or storage tent can reach the final company everything's fine.
If you, however, plan to do some processing on different parts of the island (which can make sense) or even on different islands, you will need a connection to collectors.
Try to build the farm not too close to the coast or your existing buildings since it will need some space around it to work well.
TASK: Build a farm.
trans-unit.source:
We will have a closer look at this later.
Farms, like all companies producing raw materials, do not necessarily need to be connected to storage or a Branch Office.
As long as units of the final production company can reach the farm, and collectors from the branch office or storage tent can reach the final company everything's fine.
If you, however, plan to do some processing on different parts of the island (which can make sense) or even on different islands, you will need a connection to collectors.
Try to build the farm not too close to the coast or your existing buildings since it will need some space around it to work well.
TASK: Build a farm.

trans-unit.id: Build a farm and keep some empty space around it.
trans-unit.source: Build a farm and keep some empty space around it.
trans-unit.target: Plaats een boerderij, zorg voor vrije ruimte eromheen.

trans-unit.id: NEW TASK: BUILD FIELDS
trans-unit.source: NEW TASK: BUILD FIELDS
trans-unit.target: OPDRACHT: PLAATS VELDEN

trans-unit.id:
The farm itself is not going to produce anything without some fields.
You currently have the choice between pastures, potato and sugar fields.
Let's have a short overview: * Pasture: Sheep live here, producing lamb wool. * Potato field: Grows potatoes which are currently treated as food. * Sugar field: Grows sugar which is used to make alcohol and (later) produce confectionery.
We now only need pastures, but in case your food supply chain is too small (maybe many residential buildings) you can also produce some potatoes.
Note that for potatoes you will need a road connection to the farm (not to the field!) as it will be the only company to work on the goods.
trans-unit.source:
The farm itself is not going to produce anything without some fields.
You currently have the choice between pastures, potato and sugar fields.
Let's have a short overview: * Pasture: Sheep live here, producing lamb wool. * Potato field: Grows potatoes which are currently treated as food. * Sugar field: Grows sugar which is used to make alcohol and (later) produce confectionery.
We now only need pastures, but in case your food supply chain is too small (maybe many residential buildings) you can also produce some potatoes.
Note that for potatoes you will need a road connection to the farm (not to the field!) as it will be the only company to work on the goods.
trans-unit.target:
De boerderij produceert niets zonder velden.
Er is keuze tussen weilanden, aardappel- en suikervelden. Een kort overzicht: * Weiland: Ruimte voor schapen. Produceert wol * Aarappelveld: Aardappels worden hier verbouwd. Produceert voedsel. * Suikerveld: Suiker wordt gebruikt om alcohol te maken en (later) drank te produceren
Nu hebben we alleen weiland nodig. Als het voedsel aanbod te klein is (mogelijk door veel residentiele gebouwen)kunt U ook aardappelvelden plaatsen.
Let op: voor aardappels heeft U een verbinding nodig met de boerderij - niet met het aardappelveld.

trans-unit.id:
Make sure that all fields you build are in the area covered by the farm.
You can have combined production - one pasture will not lead to 100 percent efficiency of the farm - but you need to check how many fields one farm can serve.
Different classes of fields require the farm units to spend more or less time there (to seed, harvest, herd, etc…) and because of that, the farm may be unable to serve all of the fields you built for it in time.
For now, you do not need to care about these issues a lot since you haven't built any fields. Let's change that!
TASK: Build at least one pasture in the farm's range and add potato fields if you like.
trans-unit.source:
Make sure that all fields you build are in the area covered by the farm.
You can have combined production - one pasture will not lead to 100 percent efficiency of the farm - but you need to check how many fields one farm can serve.
Different classes of fields require the farm units to spend more or less time there (to seed, harvest, herd, etc…) and because of that, the farm may be unable to serve all of the fields you built for it in time.
For now, you do not need to care about these issues a lot since you haven't built any fields. Let's change that!
TASK: Build at least one pasture in the farm's range and add potato fields if you like.
trans-unit.target:
Make sure that all fields you build are in the area covered by the farm.
You can have combined production - one pasture will not lead to 100 percent efficiency of the farm - but you need to check how many fields one farm can serve.
Different classes of fields require the farm units to spend more or less time there (to seed, harvest, herd, etc…) and because of that, the farm may be unable to serve all of the fields you built for it in time.
For now, you do not need to care about these issues a lot since you haven't built any fields. Let's change that!
TASK: Build at least one pasture in the farm's range and add potato fields if you like.

trans-unit.id: Build at least one pasture and add potato fields if you like.
trans-unit.source: Build at least one pasture and add potato fields if you like.
trans-unit.target: Plaats tenminste een weiland en voeg aardappelvelden toe naar eigen inzicht.

trans-unit.id: NEW TASK: BUILD STORAGE
trans-unit.source: NEW TASK: BUILD STORAGE
trans-unit.target: OPDRACHT: OPSLAGRUIMTE

trans-unit.id:
Did you watch your lumberjack recently?
Since your branch office does not have unlimited space to store goods, collectors will stop fetching goods from companies when stock is full. So if no sailor recently wanted to upgrade his tent, you probably have a lot of boards and in that case, the lumberjack may idle. We can improve this situation with two different approaches, and below we will have a look at both of them.
All companies offer the possibility of doing no work at all. This may sound strange, but try to click on the gear wheel you see in, for example, a lumberjack's overview.
If this 'break' mode is enabled (we call it 'Decommissioning'), the running costs you pay for the building will decrease. They won't be zero, but still lower than if you keep the company producing.
trans-unit.source:
Did you watch your lumberjack recently?
Since your branch office does not have unlimited space to store goods, collectors will stop fetching goods from companies when stock is full. So if no sailor recently wanted to upgrade his tent, you probably have a lot of boards and in that case, the lumberjack may idle. We can improve this situation with two different approaches, and below we will have a look at both of them.
All companies offer the possibility of doing no work at all. This may sound strange, but try to click on the gear wheel you see in, for example, a lumberjack's overview.
If this 'break' mode is enabled (we call it 'Decommissioning'), the running costs you pay for the building will decrease. They won't be zero, but still lower than if you keep the company producing.
trans-unit.target:
Heeft U onlangs de houthakker gezien?
Aangezien het kantoor beperkte ruimte heeft om goederen op te slaan, zullen verzamelaar stoppen goederen op te halen van bedrijven wanneer de opslagruimte vol is. Als er recentelijk geen zeelui hun tenten hebben verbeterd, heeft U waarschijnlijk veel planken. In dat geval zal de houthakker rusten. We kunnen deze situatie oplossen met twee verschillende aanpakken.
Alle bedrijven hebben de optie om buiten bedrijf gezet te worden. Dit klinkt misschien raar. Klik op het tandwiel in het houthakkers overzicht.
Als deze 'rust' in ingeschakeld zullen de onderhoudskosten van het gebouw afnemen. Onderhoudskosten zullen niet altijd helemaal nul zijn, maar allicht wel lager dan in actieve status.

trans-unit.id:
This means that you can save money when you temporarily do not need a company and do not want to tear it down, either.
Another solution is to build the last increment-I building which has not been mentioned so far: the storage tent.
This building has two purposes. It: * Offers more storage for your goods, and * sends its own collectors to fetch goods, just like the branch office does.
Note that companies can also be connected to a storage in order to get their products collected, and if the branch office is overwhelmed with collector tasks, you can place a storage tent to help out there.
TASK: Build a storage tent, preferably where you need collectors.
trans-unit.source:
This means that you can save money when you temporarily do not need a company and do not want to tear it down, either.
Another solution is to build the last increment-I building which has not been mentioned so far: the storage tent.
This building has two purposes. It: * Offers more storage for your goods, and * sends its own collectors to fetch goods, just like the branch office does.
Note that companies can also be connected to a storage in order to get their products collected, and if the branch office is overwhelmed with collector tasks, you can place a storage tent to help out there.
TASK: Build a storage tent, preferably where you need collectors.
trans-unit.target:
Dit betekent dat U geld kan besparen wanneer U tijdelijk geen bepaald bedrijf nodig heeft en het ook niet wilt slopen.
Een andere oplossing is het plaatsen van het laatste niveau I gebouw, dat nog niet besproken is: De opslag tent.
Dit gebouw heeft twee doeleinden: * Het biedt meer ruimte voor goederen * Het stuurt eigen verzamelaars om goederen te halen, zoals het kantoor doet.
Merk op dat bedrijven kunnen ook met een opslag tent verbonden worden om hun goederen op te laten halen, en als het alle verzamelaars van het kantoor bezet zijn, kan een opslag tent de oplossing bieden.
OPDRACHT: Plaats een opslag tent, bij voorkeur waar U verzamelaars nodig heeft.

trans-unit.id: Build a storage tent (increment I tab) where it makes sense.
trans-unit.source: Build a storage tent (increment I tab) where it makes sense.
trans-unit.target: Plaats een opslag tent (niveau I scherm).

trans-unit.id: NEW TASK: BUILD A WEAVER
trans-unit.source: NEW TASK: BUILD A WEAVER
trans-unit.target: OPDRACHT: KLEERMAKER

trans-unit.id:
Now the wool production is set up, you still need a weaver to produce cloth out of this wool.
There are two spots where you can build it - either close to the farm or close to a Storage Tent (or the Branch Office).
In both cases you should ensure the connection to a trail as well.
You can place the weaver close to the farm and tear down any trail to the farm to see that it will still fetch the wool and produce.
TASK: Build a weaver positioned so it can get wool.
trans-unit.source:
Now the wool production is set up, you still need a weaver to produce cloth out of this wool.
There are two spots where you can build it - either close to the farm or close to a Storage Tent (or the Branch Office).
In both cases you should ensure the connection to a trail as well.
You can place the weaver close to the farm and tear down any trail to the farm to see that it will still fetch the wool and produce.
TASK: Build a weaver positioned so it can get wool.
trans-unit.target:
Nu de wol productie gereed is heeft U nog een kleermaker nodig om kleren te fabriceren van de wol.
Er zijn twee plaatsen waar U de kleermaker kunt plaatsen - ofwel dichtbij de boerderij of dicht bij een opslag tent danwel het kantoor.
In beide gevallen dient er een verbinding met de weg te zijn.
U kunt de kleermaker dichtbij de boerderij plaatsen en alle wegen naar de boerderij afbreken om te zien dat de kleermaker alsnog wol ophaalt en kleren produceert.
OPDRACHT: Plaats een kleermaker waar het wol kan ophalen.

trans-unit.id: Build a weaver that can somehow reach the wool of your farm.
trans-unit.source: Build a weaver that can somehow reach the wool of your farm.
trans-unit.target: Plaats een kleermaker die de wel van je boerderij kan bereiken.

trans-unit.id: House a total of 50 or more inhabitants in your city to complete the tutorial. You need a positive balance.
trans-unit.source: House a total of 50 or more inhabitants in your city to complete the tutorial. You need a positive balance.
trans-unit.target: Bereik een totaal van 50 inwoners om deze tutorial te voltooien. U heeft een positieve balans nodig.

trans-unit.id: NEW TASK: COMPLETE TUTORIAL
trans-unit.source: NEW TASK: COMPLETE TUTORIAL
trans-unit.target: OPDRACHT: VOLTOOI TUTORIAL

trans-unit.id:
Try to house a total of 50 or more inhabitants in your city by providing more residential buildings.
Once you are able to keep an economy running which can satisfy this amount of consumers, you are ready to discover new Unknown Horizons!
TASK: Reach a total number of 50 inhabitants and a positive balance to complete this tutorial.
trans-unit.source:
Try to house a total of 50 or more inhabitants in your city by providing more residential buildings.
Once you are able to keep an economy running which can satisfy this amount of consumers, you are ready to discover new Unknown Horizons!
TASK: Reach a total number of 50 inhabitants and a positive balance to complete this tutorial.
trans-unit.target:
Breidt Uw stad uit naar 50 of meer inwoners door meer residentiele gebouwen te plaatsen.
Zodra U de economie draaiend kunt houden met deze hoeveelheid inwoners, bent U klaar om Unknown Horizons te verkennen! OPDRACHT: Bereik een totaal van 50 inwoners en een positieve balans om deze tutorial te voltooien.

trans-unit.id: NO TASKS LEFT
trans-unit.source: NO TASKS LEFT
trans-unit.target: GEEN OPDRACHTEN RESTEREND

trans-unit.id:
There is nothing left to do now.
If you have any suggestions on what we could or should improve, add or leave out:
www.unknown-horizons.org
#unknown-horizons @ irc.freenode.net
team@unknown-horizons.org
Our forums are open to you as well!
The best results until now were achieved by joining our IRC channel, so you could try that out first (-;
trans-unit.source:
There is nothing left to do now.
If you have any suggestions on what we could or should improve, add or leave out:
www.unknown-horizons.org
#unknown-horizons @ irc.freenode.net
team@unknown-horizons.org
Our forums are open to you as well!
The best results until now were achieved by joining our IRC channel, so you could try that out first (-;
trans-unit.target:
Er zijn geen resterende taken.
Mocht U suggesties hebben wat er verbeterd, toegevoegd of verwijderd kan worden: www.unknown-horizons.org
#unknown-horizons @ irc.freenode.net
team@unknown-horizons.org
De forums zijn open voor iedereen!
De beste resultaten tot nu toe zijn behaald via het IRC kanaal, wij raden aan dit eerst te proberen (-;

trans-unit.source: Thanks!
trans-unit.target: Dank U wel!

trans-unit.id:
Thanks for playing the tutorial!
Your UH-Team
trans-unit.source:
Thanks for playing the tutorial!
Your UH-Team
trans-unit.target:
Bedankt voor het spelen van de Tutorial!
Het UH-Team

trans-unit.id: Congratulations! You have reached the end of this tutorial and are ready to meet new challenges!
trans-unit.source: Congratulations! You have reached the end of this tutorial and are ready to meet new challenges!
trans-unit.target: Gefeliciteerd! U heeft het einde van deze handleiding bereikt en bent nu klaar voor nieuwe uitdagingen!
